replies.msg:
Currently spending his vacations in Brazil, Chelsea left-back Emerson Palmieri attended ESPN’s show Futebol no Mundo on Monday.

Palmieri was directly asked who will be Chelsea’s manager next season, with journalists naming Frank Lampard as a strong candidate. But he claims not to know anything.

“It’s a strong name. I’m here now, I’m on vacation, so…,” Emerson Palmieri told ESPN Brasil.

Emerson was also asked about a move to Juventus, since the Italian press has been claiming that Maurizio Sarri would want to take him to the Old Lady. However, the Brazilian claims he “doesn’t know anything” about the interest, and “nothing came” for him so far. He also insists he’s pretty happy at Chelsea.

#cfc hope to finalise deal for #Lampard to become their new manager by the end of the week. (Standard)

Lampard has been away on holiday in France, but as revealed by Standard Sport earlier in the week, he has already informed Derby of his desire to join Chelsea if the opportunity arises.

Chelsea are sure Lampard wants to be their next coach and become part of a new set-up that will also include Petr Cech in a technical director role.

The west London club want to avoid a repeat of last year when Sarri took over from Antonio Conte after pre-season had already begun.

Those players not involved in international duty earlier this month are due to report back in a few weeks and Chelsea want Lampard to have plenty of time to prepare for the new campaign.
Ross County Football Club are delighted to announce that @ChelseaFC goalkeeper, Nathan Baxter, has joined the club on a season long loan deal. (Subject to international clearance).

Luis Enrique has stepped down as manager of
the Spain national team for personal reasons.
Antonio Rudiger doesn't want to rush back from another injury, meaning he could miss the start of next season. @Matt_Law_DT reports

quote.msg: Antonio Rudiger doesn't want to rush back from another injury, meaning he could miss the start of next season. @Matt_Law_DT reports

replies.msg:
Rudiger has not suffered a set-back in his rehabilitation and is said to be recovering well, but he is determined not to rush back ahead of schedule.

Chelsea believe the 26-year-old may not be ready for the first Premier League game of the season against Manchester United at Old Trafford on August 11 and the Super Cup clash against Liverpool three days later.

Chelsea’s players remain convinced that Lampard will be appointed to succeed Sarri in plenty of time for the start of pre-season training in the first week of July.

Lampard has been on holiday in France, but Chelsea have been discussing the potential make-up of his backroom team with Joe Edwards set for a promotion from the Academy.

Edwards has already worked with Lampard’s assistant Jody Morris and has an in-depth knowledge of the club’s young players.
